info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 4:51PM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...BRIEF FREEZING TEMPERATURES EXPECTED OVER EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE COASTAL COUNTIES OF THE MIDDLE TEXAS COAST EARLY MONDAY MORNING... In response to an arctic airmass, cold temperatures are expected tonight over the eastern portions of the coastal counties of the Middle Texas coast. In addition, the combination of light wind, clear skies and dry conditions, will contribute to strong radiational cooling. Temperatures over these areas are expected to fall to around the freezing temperature of 32 degrees Fahrenheit. However, freezing temperatures over these areas are expected to occur for less than 2 hours. Therefore, a Freeze Warning has not been issued for this region. Areas affected by this expected brief freeze include, but not limited to, Seadrift, Portland, and Corpus Christi. Freezing temperatures are not anticipated along the barrier islands. If more cooling occurs than currently anticipated, a Freeze Warning may be issued for select locations near the coast.
